revised_title: Observations on the Minute Anatomy of Frog's Tongue Papillae
tldr: The author investigates the minute anatomy of the fungiform papillae of the frog's tongue, focusing on the connective tissue, epithelium, and nerve fibers. The study reveals differences between the epithelium on the papilla's summit and that on its sides, as well as the presence of nerve fibers in the papilla's body and on its summit.
